title.value: Increasing schedule reliability in the multiple depot vehicle scheduling problem with stochastic travel time
title.justification: The title directly corresponds to the content and focus of the paper, as it deals with improving schedule reliability in vehicle scheduling problems considering stochastic travel times.
title.quote: Increasing schedule reliability in the multiple depot vehicle scheduling problem with stochastic travel time

extractions.description: This paper introduces a data-driven model to increase the reliability of the multiple depot vehicle scheduling problem with stochastic travel time (R-MDVSP-STT). It proposes a heuristic branch-and-price algorithm and a labeling algorithm with a stochastic dominance criterion. The paper demonstrates, through computational tests on real-world instances from Montréal, that the proposed method efficiently balances operational costs and schedule reliability.

type.justification: The paper conducts computational tests on real-world instances from the city of Montréal to demonstrate the effectiveness of its model and algorithms, indicating it is based on empirical research.
type.quote: Computational results on real-life instances show that our method can efficiently find good trade-offs between operational costs and reliability, improving the reliability of the solutions with little cost increase.

name.justification: The paper addresses a specific operational problem in public transport service planning, focusing on the vehicle scheduling problem with stochastic travel times.
name.quote: The multiple depot vehicle scheduling problem (MDVSP) is one of the most studied problems in public transport service planning.

name.justification: The paper introduces a stochastic programming model for the vehicle scheduling problem, incorporating stochastic travel times.
name.quote: This work introduces a data-driven model to the reliable MDVSP with stochastic travel time (R-MDVSP-STT).

name.justification: The paper proposes a heuristic branch-and-price algorithm and experiments different algorithmic strategies for solving the scheduling problem.
name.quote: We propose a heuristic branch-and-price algorithm to solve this problem and a labeling algorithm with a stochastic dominance criterion for the associated subproblems.

name.justification: The dataset used in the computational results comprises travel data from the Montréal bus network used to predict travel time distributions.
name.quote: Computational results on real-life instances show that our method can efficiently find good trade-offs between operational costs and reliability...The best probabilistic model for predicting the travel time distributions of the Montréal bus network, as well as its features and parameters, were selected in a previous work [9] based on a dataset of various attributes of more than 41,000 trips collected over a two-month period.

referenced_paper_title.value: Predicting the probability distribution of bus travel time to measure the reliability of public transport services
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper is explicitly focused on predicting travel time distributions, which is crucial for the dataset's application in the current study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The best probabilistic model for predicting the travel time distributions of the Montréal bus network, as well as its features and parameters, were selected in a previous work [9]...
